page.title: 01The Winster area
page.content: This valley in the centre of the area is a predominately rural land, with one small township called Winster. Two rivers flow through it from North to South, the Winster and the Gilpin, and there are several tarns, springs and wells. The terrain is mixed woodland and grass divided by stone walls and a few hedges. There are guest houses, one public house, bed and breakfast houses and self-catering accomodation and holiday homes. The population of the whole area is estimated at 500, but not enough young children for ther to be a primary school. It is an ideal place for leisure, natural history pursuits but there are no houses for young people, no work and no public transport, which reduces it to farming and holidays, with one shop, one village hall and one public house.
